intro: Ruizterania obtusata subsp. obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved Ruizterania, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, elliptical fruits that mature into a dark brown color. Ruizterania obtusata subsp. obtusata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
